article_title: Longmont-area events for Saturday, May 2: Cinco de Mayo
article_text:
Today

•Human Trafficking In Our Backyard —Seize the opportunity to learn about human trafficking from some of the most well informed professionals in Colorado, 9 a.m. at Heart of Longmont Methodist Church, 350 11th Ave., Longmont.

•Cinco de Mayo—Enjoy food, live entertainment, car show and more, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Roosevelt Park, 700 Longs Peak Ave., Longmont. Go to www.longmontcincodemayo.com

• East Boulder County Artist Studio Tour —Artist Studio Tour and Sale. Tour various artists studios in Erie, Lafayette, Longmont and Louisville, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. today and Sunday. There is no cost. For a map, go to ebcacolorado.org. Call 303-772-7293.

• Derby Dash —The Mead Area Chamber of Commerce will be hosting a Derby Dash where racers will gallop on stick horses, runners will be disqualified, 3 p.m. at the Mead Town Hall, 441 Third St., Mead. Call 303-517-5281.

Advertisement

• Longmont Dance Theatre presents The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe Spring Gala —The group will perform the adaptation from Artistic Director Kristin Kingsley at 2 p.m. today and 1 p.m. Sunday at Niwot High School Auditorium, 8989 Niwot Road, Niwot. Cost is $15 to $20. Go to longmontdancetheatre.com

Upcoming

• Community Handbell Concert —The concert features handbell choirs from Bethlehem Lutheran, First Evangelical Lutheran, Heart of Longmont, Longs Peak United Methodist, and Messiah Lutheran, 3:30 p.m., Sunday, Longs Peak United Methodist Church, 1421 Elmhurst Drive, Longmont. Call 303-776-0399.

• Anime Club —Come watch and discuss anime and learn about Japanese culture. For teens in sixth to 12 grades, 3 p.m., Sunday, Longmont Public Library, 409 Fourth Ave., Longmont. Call 303-651-8470.
